channel.title: Site Style
channel.description:
I work as a web designer, but I have never actually taken a poll like this. Please be as truthful as possible with your answers.
Option 1: Simple, Site stretches to fit your window. 2-4 colors, no images besides banner. Option 2: Simple, Site is set at a certain width (usually between 600 and 800 pixels). 2-4 colors, no images besides banner. Option 3: Advanced, Site contains many images and site stretches to fit your screen. Therefore, images would not be varying in shape/size. Option 4: Advanced, Site contains a lot of images (few more than above option) and site is set at a certain width. Therefore, images can be much more unique in size and shape. Option 5: Other >> Please post what you like.
-Alexia

item.title: Site Style
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

depends on what the site is

forums should stretch to my screen

news/blog sites should be centered and certain size

as for images…I LOVE DIGG!! its simple and clean yet looks damn good

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

My main site (see link) has too many images and stuff that it sucks. But other sites of me are clean, and they look nicer i think
Option 2

Read full topic

item.title: Site Style
item.dc:creator: @alexia alexia
item.description:
@alexia wrote:

I am talking about look, not content.

By simple, I mean… 1px solid, straight black line borders, not many colors, everything is shaped as rectangles…

By “advanced” I mean… there are more variations in the style, such as the use of images as headers, etc…

-Alexia

Read full topic

item.title: Site Style
item.dc:creator: @N4TH4N N4TH4N
item.description:
@N4TH4N wrote:

Simple sites that get the job done are more practical, “fun” sites can do whatever they want as long as the content is good.

Read full topic
